description.text: You are channeling the sole of the Arch Diggle. As a leader of society, you radiate caddishness. As a powerful drill-oriented warrior, you destroy your opponents with powerful blows. At this rank, your kung-fu is so powerful, the seemingly physically impossible might happen at any moment...
You've initiated the Gangnam Beat. You hit harder and move more rhythmically until it stops reverberating. Other Gangnam Style abilities cannot be used without the Gangnam Beat.

It's the Weirdly Erotic Sideways Shuffle! You look (and are) excessively *cool* while you do the Sideways Shuffle, and you move to the side when hit in combat, knocking anything there aside (if space is available - if not, you'll just get a free smack in on the creature next to you.)
Is it pretend? Or is it merely invisible? Your enemies seem to think it's real enough! Keep imagining!
It's a giant fireball. It goes BOOM. But you don't know what it looks like. How could you? You're never looking when it goes off.
It's a giant fireball. It goes BOOM. But you don't know what it looks like. How could you? You're never looking when it goes off.
You are one true avatar of Gangnam. At least until you switch back to one of the other dances.
You used a toxic poison on your weapon, and a little bit remains. It'll wear off shortly.

You have a chance to poison your enemies with something mysterious that never manages to show up in your inventory or be used for any other purpose.
Deals toxic damage to one being. Indiscrete use of this toxin may provoke economic sanctimoniousness.
You've been Anti-poisoned! You don't heal normally because your system is trying to fight the anti-poison off, but you heal from the anti-poison quite handily.
You have a chance to poison your enemies very badly with something mysterious that never manages to show up in your inventory or be used for any other purpose.
These poisons are grotesque and stinky, putrefying your foes from the inside out.
These poisons are sticky and chemical, consuming your foes from the outside in.
Your speech is so boring that people fade out...and even after they recover, they'll be out of it for a while. Some very weak enemies might even be bored to death!

You've mastered the simplest form of energy manipulation: elementalism. Depending on where you point this spell, one of four various elemental effects will happen. The very clever might even find ways to invoke more than one with a single casting.
You've crafted yourself a small sheet of enchanted obsidian that is very reflective to enemy magic. Get hit too many times and it will fall apart on you.
Your exposure to magic-wielding under the influence of Glorious Power has left you permanently the opposite of scarred.

You have given yourself the Arcane Consecration of the Archmage. So long as you do not participate in combat, your magic is both powerful and glorious. (Too bad that whole 'staying out of combat' thing never lasts.)
Excellent! Now slay another and twine their souls together like a good little Archmage.
Good. Now drink something in rememberance of the blood of your fallen foe.
Good. Now eat something in rememberance of the body of your fallen foe.
You've just forced a massive adrenaline dump in your own body! You're stronger, faster, and more stubborn than ever, but you can't exactly think straight.

You're moving much more slowly, like a plant. On the plus side, you're also turning light into life, like a plant. Cry deeply, like a plant, because plants don't really benefit from food or booze -- you can't photosynthesize and digest at the same time.
Cast this on a corpse to turn it into a delicious fungi!
You've moved on to the next most divine form of magic: that of nature itself, stripped of it's elemental ornamentation. A differet variety of effects occur depending on where you point this power.
Your magic is freaking STRONG. And costly -- every spell you cast saps your mana more than you might expect.
Your magic is much cheaper than normal. As a side effect, your ability to resist enemy magic is slightly reduced.
Your magic does more than normal. Unfortunately, this saps your ability to regenerate mana naturally.
The Elder Beings have granted you access to one nth of their vast intellect and cosmic power. Keep collecting those nths, and they might add up to something truly impressive over time.

You have the attention, and a sliver of the power of, the Elder Beings. If you manage to kill a creature using their power (not your own), they will take the victim's body and soul (and anything else on that square, so be careful!) off to the Distant Realms. If they decide the victim is worthy, they'll grant you a small but persistent boon.
Your exposure to vile magicks has left your willpower sapped and your brain scrambled. Don't keep it up, or you'll be without Will.
You've got the Vile Infestation. Or maybe it's more appropriate to say IT has YOU.
Nothin' like packing down more beer when youre alredy geting durnken.
Your mind. It's expanding. Like the universe...is...expanding. Woaaaahhhh...
